Question description: In questions given below, a part of the sentence is italicised and underlined. Below are given alternatives to the italicised part which may improve the sentence. Choose the correct alternative. In case no improvement is needed, option 'D' is the answer.

1.Question: The workers are hell bent at getting what is due to them.

2.Question: When it was feared that the serfs might go too far and gain their freedom from serfdom, the protestant leaders joined the princes at crushing them.

3.Question: If the room had been brighter, I would have been able to read for a while before bed time.

4.Question: The record for the biggest tiger hunt has not been met since 1911 when Lord Hardinge. then Viceroy of India, shot a tiger than measured 11 feet and 6 inches.

5.Question: his powerful desire brought about his downfall.

6.Question: Will you kindly open the knot?

7.Question: He sent a word to me that he would be coming late.

8.Question: John had told me that he hasn't done it yet.

9.Question: If he had time he will call you.

10.Question: Will you lend me few rupees in this hour of need?

11.Question: During his long discourse, he did not touch that point.

12.Question: He found a wooden broken chair in the room.

13.Question: He could not look anything in the dark room.

14.Question: The greatest thing in style is to have a use of metaphor.

15.Question: While crossing the highway a five year old child was knocked out by a passing car.

16.Question: hoping not to be disturbed, I sat down in my easy chair to read the book. I won as a prize.
options: I had won as a prize
I had to win as a prize

17.Question: More than one person was killed in accident.

18.Question: No one could explain how a calm and balanced person like him could penetrate such a mindless act on his friends.

19.Question: Five years ago today, I am sitting in a small Japanese car, driving across Poland towards Berlin.

20.Question: I took the cycle which he bought yesterday.
options: that which he had bought yesterday

21.Question: Please make it a point to send you letter at my address.

22.Question: If you are living near a market place you should be ready to bear the disturbances caused by traffic.

23.Question: I hope you won't object to me watching while you work.

25.Question: 20 kms are not a great distance in these days of fast moving vehicles.

26.Question: The more they earn, more they spend.
options: More they earn, more they spend
More they earn, the more they spend
The more they earn, the more they spend

27.Question: It became clear that the strangers were heading into a serious disaster.

28.Question: The dissidents hold a great problem in every political party.

29.Question: I would have waited for you at the station if I knew that you would come.

30.Question: They are social insects, living in communities, regulated by definite laws, each member of society bearing well-defined and separate part in the work of a colony.

31.Question: Practically every part of the banana tree is used by man.

32.Question: My opinion for the film is that it will bag the national ward.

33.Question: The end of the examinations is (an) oppurtunity for celebrating.

34.Question: We were not the wiser for all this effort to explain the case to us.

35.Question: Whenever my students come across new words, I ask them to look for them in the dictionary.

36.Question: We look forward to hear from you.

37.Question: It was indeed a shock for her, but she has later recovered from it.

38.Question: Realising is the significance of technical education for developing country, the government laid aside a large sum on it during the last plan-period.

39.Question: If you are not clear about the meaning of a word, it is wise to look to a dictionary.

40.Question: You are warned against committing the same mistake again.

41.Question: No sooner he had returned home then his mother felt happy.

42.Question: He should move on to the next point, and not harp one sting only.

43.Question: Either he or I am going.
options: he is going or I am

44.Question: I hope you vividly remember the premier of the film when I, my wife and you were present in the hall.

45.Question: To get one's name in the Rowland Ward's book of hunting records was the hot ambition of every serious hunter.

46.Question: Taxpayers are to be conscious of their privileges.

47.Question: As she was suffering from high fever, she could not face the examination.

49.Question: Every time I go in a lift to my sixth floor apartment, I remember the calm and serenity of my ancestral home in the village.

50.Question: In fact, if it hadn't been for his invaluable advice on so many occasions I wouldn't have achieved anything in life.

51.Question: Mr. Smith arrived at India in June last year.

52.Question: But in all these cases conversion from scale have well-formulated.

53.Question: With a thundering roar the huge rocket soared up from the launching pad.

54.Question: There is dearth of woman doctor in our state. We shall have to recruit some from the other states.

55.Question: If you cross the line you will be disqualified.

56.Question: Why the dinosaurs died out is not known.

57.Question: His father won't be able to leave for Varnasi until they have arrived.

58.Question: I will not go to school, if it shall rain tomorrow.

59.Question: If I stood alone in defence of truth, and the whole world is banded against me and against truth. I would fight them all.

60.Question: He has not and can never be in the good books of his employer because he lacks honesty.
options: has not and can never been
has not been and can never be

61.Question: When the examinations were over Anil and me went to our native town.

62.Question: Our office clock is not so correct as it should be it is usually five minutes fast.

63.Question: The cloud of misfortunes appears to have blown out.

64.Question: While we would like that all Indian Children to go to school, we need to ponder why they do not.
options: if all the children of India

65.Question: In India today many of our intellectuals still talk in terms of the French Revolution and the Rights of Man, not appreciating that much has happened since then.

66.Question: I shall be grateful to you if you are of help to me now.

67.Question: The logic of Berlin wall already had been undermined but when the news came through that the wall itself had been opened I jumped into a car.

68.Question: Other countries have eradicated this disease ten years ago.

69.Question: Young men and women should get habituated to reading and writing about current affairs.

70.Question: The poor villagers have waited in the bitter cold for more than 4 hours now.

71.Question: The old man felled some trees in the garden with hardly no effort at all.

72.Question: The company goes to great length to ensure that employees can be comfortable in their work environment.

73.Question: I want you to clearly understand that excuses won't do

74.Question: He was fined for careless driving.

75.Question: Although India is still by far a poor country, it can become rich if its natural and human resources are fully utilised.

76.Question: The reason why he wrote the letter was because he could not contact him over the phone.
options: why he wrote the letter was since
for which he wrote the letter because
why he wrote the letter was that

77.Question: As he is past his teens now, he can look for himself.

78.Question: There is no more room for you in this compartment.

79.Question: Most donors would seriously protest any effort to extrapolate from such limited data.

80.Question: She says she's already paid me back, but I can't remember, so I 'll have to take her word.
options: to take her at her word
to take her word for it

81.Question: If you had attended the meeting, you would have benefited a great deal.

82.Question: This matter admits of no excuse.

83.Question: If he would have tried he would have succeeded.

84.Question: It will be no good trying to find an excuse next time.

85.Question: Please remind me of posting these letters to my relatives.

86.Question: Not a word they spoke to the unfortunate wife about it

87.Question: Not long back, in Japan, a mysterious nerve gas affected a large number of people.

88.Question: We had nothing to eat since 8'o clock, this morning.

89.Question: We did not see this movie yet.

90.Question: My friend was in hospital for a week after an accident.

91.Question: All, but her, had made an attempt.

92.Question: Whatever to our other problems. we have no shortcoming to cheap labour in India.

93.Question: I have lived in Delhi since I was four.

94.Question: This telephone number is not existing.

95.Question: I shall not go untill I am invited.

96.Question: He died in the year 1960 at 11pm on 14 July.
options: on 14 July in the year 1960 at 11pm
in the year 1960 on 14 July at 11pm
at 11pm on 14 July in the year 1960

97.Question: Due to these reason we are all in favour of universal compulsory education.

2.Question: When it was feared that the serfs might go too far and gain their freedom from serfdom, the protestant leaders joined the princes at crushing them.

3.Question: If the room had been brighter, I would have been able to read for a while before bed time.

4.Question: The record for the biggest tiger hunt has not been met since 1911 when Lord Hardinge. then Viceroy of India, shot a tiger than measured 11 feet and 6 inches.

5.Question: his powerful desire brought about his downfall.

6.Question: Will you kindly open the knot?

7.Question: He sent a word to me that he would be coming late.

8.Question: John had told me that he hasn't done it yet.

9.Question: If he had time he will call you.

10.Question: Will you lend me few rupees in this hour of need?

11.Question: During his long discourse, he did not touch that point.

12.Question: He found a wooden broken chair in the room.

13.Question: He could not look anything in the dark room.

14.Question: The greatest thing in style is to have a use of metaphor.

15.Question: While crossing the highway a five year old child was knocked out by a passing car.

16.Question: hoping not to be disturbed, I sat down in my easy chair to read the book. I won as a prize.
options: I had won as a prize
I had to win as a prize

17.Question: More than one person was killed in accident.

18.Question: No one could explain how a calm and balanced person like him could penetrate such a mindless act on his friends.

19.Question: Five years ago today, I am sitting in a small Japanese car, driving across Poland towards Berlin.

20.Question: I took the cycle which he bought yesterday.
options: that which he had bought yesterday

21.Question: Please make it a point to send you letter at my address.

22.Question: If you are living near a market place you should be ready to bear the disturbances caused by traffic.

23.Question: I hope you won't object to me watching while you work.

25.Question: 20 kms are not a great distance in these days of fast moving vehicles.

26.Question: The more they earn, more they spend.
options: More they earn, more they spend
More they earn, the more they spend
The more they earn, the more they spend

27.Question: It became clear that the strangers were heading into a serious disaster.

28.Question: The dissidents hold a great problem in every political party.

29.Question: I would have waited for you at the station if I knew that you would come.

30.Question: They are social insects, living in communities, regulated by definite laws, each member of society bearing well-defined and separate part in the work of a colony.

31.Question: Practically every part of the banana tree is used by man.

32.Question: My opinion for the film is that it will bag the national ward.

33.Question: The end of the examinations is (an) oppurtunity for celebrating.

34.Question: We were not the wiser for all this effort to explain the case to us.

35.Question: Whenever my students come across new words, I ask them to look for them in the dictionary.

36.Question: We look forward to hear from you.

37.Question: It was indeed a shock for her, but she has later recovered from it.

38.Question: Realising is the significance of technical education for developing country, the government laid aside a large sum on it during the last plan-period.

39.Question: If you are not clear about the meaning of a word, it is wise to look to a dictionary.

40.Question: You are warned against committing the same mistake again.

41.Question: No sooner he had returned home then his mother felt happy.

42.Question: He should move on to the next point, and not harp one sting only.

43.Question: Either he or I am going.
options: he is going or I am

44.Question: I hope you vividly remember the premier of the film when I, my wife and you were present in the hall.

45.Question: To get one's name in the Rowland Ward's book of hunting records was the hot ambition of every serious hunter.

46.Question: Taxpayers are to be conscious of their privileges.

47.Question: As she was suffering from high fever, she could not face the examination.

49.Question: Every time I go in a lift to my sixth floor apartment, I remember the calm and serenity of my ancestral home in the village.

50.Question: In fact, if it hadn't been for his invaluable advice on so many occasions I wouldn't have achieved anything in life.

51.Question: Mr. Smith arrived at India in June last year.

52.Question: But in all these cases conversion from scale have well-formulated.

53.Question: With a thundering roar the huge rocket soared up from the launching pad.

54.Question: There is dearth of woman doctor in our state. We shall have to recruit some from the other states.

55.Question: If you cross the line you will be disqualified.

56.Question: Why the dinosaurs died out is not known.

57.Question: His father won't be able to leave for Varnasi until they have arrived.

58.Question: I will not go to school, if it shall rain tomorrow.

59.Question: If I stood alone in defence of truth, and the whole world is banded against me and against truth. I would fight them all.

60.Question: He has not and can never be in the good books of his employer because he lacks honesty.
options: has not and can never been
has not been and can never be

61.Question: When the examinations were over Anil and me went to our native town.

62.Question: Our office clock is not so correct as it should be it is usually five minutes fast.

63.Question: The cloud of misfortunes appears to have blown out.

64.Question: While we would like that all Indian Children to go to school, we need to ponder why they do not.
options: if all the children of India

65.Question: In India today many of our intellectuals still talk in terms of the French Revolution and the Rights of Man, not appreciating that much has happened since then.

66.Question: I shall be grateful to you if you are of help to me now.

67.Question: The logic of Berlin wall already had been undermined but when the news came through that the wall itself had been opened I jumped into a car.

68.Question: Other countries have eradicated this disease ten years ago.

69.Question: Young men and women should get habituated to reading and writing about current affairs.

70.Question: The poor villagers have waited in the bitter cold for more than 4 hours now.

71.Question: The old man felled some trees in the garden with hardly no effort at all.

72.Question: The company goes to great length to ensure that employees can be comfortable in their work environment.

73.Question: I want you to clearly understand that excuses won't do

74.Question: He was fined for careless driving.

75.Question: Although India is still by far a poor country, it can become rich if its natural and human resources are fully utilised.

76.Question: The reason why he wrote the letter was because he could not contact him over the phone.
options: why he wrote the letter was since
for which he wrote the letter because
why he wrote the letter was that

77.Question: As he is past his teens now, he can look for himself.

78.Question: There is no more room for you in this compartment.

79.Question: Most donors would seriously protest any effort to extrapolate from such limited data.

80.Question: She says she's already paid me back, but I can't remember, so I 'll have to take her word.
options: to take her at her word
to take her word for it

81.Question: If you had attended the meeting, you would have benefited a great deal.

82.Question: This matter admits of no excuse.

83.Question: If he would have tried he would have succeeded.

84.Question: It will be no good trying to find an excuse next time.

85.Question: Please remind me of posting these letters to my relatives.

86.Question: Not a word they spoke to the unfortunate wife about it

87.Question: Not long back, in Japan, a mysterious nerve gas affected a large number of people.

88.Question: We had nothing to eat since 8'o clock, this morning.

89.Question: We did not see this movie yet.

90.Question: My friend was in hospital for a week after an accident.

91.Question: All, but her, had made an attempt.

92.Question: Whatever to our other problems. we have no shortcoming to cheap labour in India.

93.Question: I have lived in Delhi since I was four.

94.Question: This telephone number is not existing.

95.Question: I shall not go untill I am invited.

96.Question: He died in the year 1960 at 11pm on 14 July.
options: on 14 July in the year 1960 at 11pm
in the year 1960 on 14 July at 11pm
at 11pm on 14 July in the year 1960

97.Question: Due to these reason we are all in favour of universal compulsory education.
